Pre-Game Insights: West Indies will be opening their T20 World Cup 2024 campaign against Papua New Guinea on June 2, 2024, at the Providence Stadium, Guyana.
The average first innings score at the Providence Stadium in T20I encounters since 2022 is 168, with teams preferring to bat second.
Spinners have been effective at the venue, maintaining an economy rate of 6.94 in the 24 T20Is played since 2022.
West Indies are looking to redeem themselves after a challenging run in the 2021 and 2022 editions of the T20 World Cup.
Papua New Guinea aims to make a significant impact, with ten of their players having participated in the 2021 edition and only four players below the age of 25.
